alert.note: Alert for Bennington; Eastern Windham; Western Windham (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 12 at 5:45AM EST by NWS Albany
info.description: ...Showers with gusty winds will impact portions of northeastern Berkshire, northeastern Columbia, southeastern Rensselaer, Bennington and Windham Counties through 645 AM EST... At 543 AM EST, Doppler radar was tracking showers with gusty winds along a line extending from Cambridge to near Hoosick Falls to near Valatie. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Heavy rains could cause ponding of water on roads and areas of poor drainage. Locations impacted include... Pittsfield, Bennington, North Adams, Brattleboro, Arlington, Townshend, Stratton, Adams, Williamstown, Shaftsbury, Pownal, Cheshire, Stephentown, Putney, New Lebanon, Wilmington, Stamford, Readsboro, Florida and Hancock. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
